name: Fraser Suites Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, beautiful setting. Great shower & bath facilities. Disappointing service for the price paid. Lacks attention to detail.
reviews.title: Service lacks attention to detail

likes.disliked: — Lack of attentionto details in service personnel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: A few examples. Bedside lamps x 2 did not work. Bedroom TV did not work. Iron made marks on my dress when I tried to use it. Wardrobe lacked lighting so going through clothes was mainly in the dark. Tried to get staff's help but receive lacklustre responses. Cutlery were not very clean, obviously not checked upon after previous visitors' departure. On a few occasions we gave way to staff with cleaning equipment in the lifts. Do they not have/use service lifts?
reviews.title: Much better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a mystery hotel package though WOTIF and were given this hotel. We booked a single deluxe room to attend a conference at Darling Harbour for the June long weekend.
reviews.title: Great bang for buck

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception was efficient and as requested they allowed us an early check in to change for a matinee show we were attending.
reviews.title: Smooth Sailing
Nearly there...
reviews.text: The front office staff member Belinda went beyond what I expected as great hospitality when my wife asked if the room we had booked had a bath. Belinda showed us our booked room and another room on the 37th floor which had a bath. We were upgraded to this second room and the view was exceptional to encompass the harbour to north head and also around to include some of Darling Harbour.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here for wedding anniversary. everything nice and new. we found staff to be very accomadating and helpful. we requested early check in and it was no problem. we had breakfast while there wasnt huge range it was enough. im glad it was included in hotel deal cause i read on review some one paid 32 dollars definetly not worth that. can eat out side for lot less with better choices. found the bed fantastic it was latex mattress and very very comfy. would just go back for that. definetly would stay again.
reviews.title: great view

likes.liked: — fantastic view and great bed. no traffic noise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Having got a good deal on wotif.com I stayed here for 3 nights. Having read the other reviews I was a little concerned before the stay regarding some of the issues but found very little to find fault with. The studio room was fine for one person and the bathroom was top end - although no bath might not suit everyone - as I like walk in showers I was very happy. The choice of TV stations was a pleasant surprise too as it was a delight to be able to watch Liverpool beat Chelsea ! I was most impressed with the Gym/pool area - so often even in 'top' hotels the gym appears to be an afterthoght in a small windowless room somewhere. Here there is a decent sized gym with 3 solid running machines - my choice - as well as other steppers /weights etc which I didn't use. There was also a nice 20m lap pool and small jacuzzi both of which were good. The only minor quibble was the lack of fresh towels in the leisure area first thing in the morning when I used the facilities. I tried the breakfast one day and it was fine though not particularly cheap 22 aud for continental buffer or 32 for including cooked option. That said it was high end and a relaxing way to start the day. The cleaning I found to be fine in the suites and the Molton Brown stuff is nice and they seemed fine about fresh supplies every day. The location is good - you can get to Town Hall station in no time - lifts availabe there if you come by train from the airport so no steps from the train to the hotel which is handy if you only have light luggage and don't fancy the taxi queues. You can also walk underground to the main shopping area via town hall station and the QVB from the corner of Kent and Bathurst Streets which is handy if it rains.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: In summary if you fancy an up to date , contemporary good value lodging experience then I would recommend it.
reviews.title: Beautifully Built Fraser Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Unfortunately, I decided to call Fraser Suites for my wedding anniversary stay on a Sunday night. I spoke to Michael who told me that I could have the 2 bedroom penthouse for my wedding anniversary for $550 dollars as they have only been open for a month and they were not busy. I thought I would check with my wife before I spent the money, and when I called back I was silly enough to mention that I have 2 small kids (a 4 yr old and a 2 yr old) that will be in the second room. Then things started to become strange... I was told that the manager would need to call me back??? and I was asked how I was going to pay??, and that it was non refundable.??? I said Amex and ok on non refundable.
reviews.title: Dodgy, discriminatory, baiting with a price then changing it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I waited 30 minutes and then called back to speak to Johnny the manager, who told me that they had to check availability as they were doing previews with clients?? Once again I said ok, and he said he would ring me back within the hour.
reviews.title: Just needs John Cleese

likes.disliked: — Unclean, unprofessional, lack of customer service

reviews.title: lovely rooms, terrible service
reviews.text: 30 minutes later, Michael (not Johnny the manager) rings me again to say that they cannot offer me that room at $550, as the minimum price for that room was $750!! WHAT IS GOING ON??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I decided that it felt all too dodgy to spend either $750 or $550, and I ended up going to the Hilton instead. The Hilton got my money and we had a wonderful time in a relaxation suite.
reviews.title: Lacks ‘ambience’ - Give it a bit more time.

likes.liked: — The room was nice and location was excellent. Handy to everything in the Sydney CBD. Friendly staff.
likes.disliked: — Not clean enough for the amount of money we paid. View wasnt great either.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Hotel rooms for me are pretty simple, a view with light, clean, doesn't smell, and GOOD SERVICE.
reviews.title: Good location, spacious and well appointed

likes.liked: — The well designed and spacious kitchen / dining / lounge area attached to bedroom
likes.disliked: — The doors were very heavy and hard to prop open for 'connecting' suites; also expensive internet

reviews.title: Good looking, but terrible service
reviews.text: Was really looking forward to staying at new hotel in good location. After booking on line and then phoning to make sure room had two beds, arrived back to check in (3 times) found that there was no prioriety for this service and that even still, at much insistence, the beds were not separated. It took a no. of hours to rectify this mistake. The set-up of room was nice, but nothing in the fridge, no milk, no water, nothing. Unusual. Also, rooms were not made up the next day, despite someone knocking on our door at 8am to see if we needed more towels. When asked about this, there was no real response, but later admission that understaffed. Seems reception staff were completely overloaded and stressed. Later my friend wanted to get something to eat in the area or some takeaway advice as pouring with rain and she didn't know area. Could not be helped and did not receive any of pamphlets for takeaway as requested. Generally no request could be dealt with efficiently without feeling it was a stress on the staff. Also the entire stay the corridors were peppered with vacumn cleaners and blue laundry baskets.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Also no in-house movies. Just generally a real lack of service for the price and placement of the hotel.
reviews.title: There are better places out there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would be very hard pushed to return.
reviews.title: Good rooms but unprofessional, dreadful service
A Stylish Abode
reviews.text: Well I chose to stay in this serviced apartment after knowing that the building and its interior is designed by architectural firm Foster & Partners. Upon arrival, I was impressed by its design and finishings which exudes simplicity and elegance, undoubtedly a creation of a renowned architect. The room(we had the studio) is also designed in the modern contemporary feel with quality finishings all around. Size of the room is a bit small, but the design was quite brilliant in saving space as many stuff are hidden in wall cabinets. Bathroom is clean, well maintained and bright. Toiletries supplied are that of Bolton Brown of London, expensive range!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Apart from the above, it's location on Kent St is excellent, within walking distance to china town, Town Hall, QVB etc. If you know of the world famous restaurant Tetsuya, it's just across the road.
reviews.title: Roler coaster of service

likes.liked: — The views. The location. The friendly and polite room cleaners.
likes.disliked: — the very UNFRENDLY front desk attendant. Reception was genrally not good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is just satisfactory, it lacks the warmth and friedliness of asian hospitality.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended...Read Why

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Now, what I dont like are:-
reviews.title: Great location

likes.liked: — More space to move around than a normal 5* hotel room
likes.disliked: — Room not fully set up on arrival

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - matteress is too soft, those wth backache will have a problem
reviews.title: Just fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is only just over a year old - and it is beautiful. The service is outstanding, with a beautiful reception area to welcome you
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in a Studio Suite on the 40th floor with 180 degrees of Sydney from Darling Harbour to Woolloomooloo.
reviews.title: Very good, recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was perfect, very modern with huge glass windows (that opened for fresh air)
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym is state of the art and the heated pool and spa were delightful.
reviews.title: Fantastic Fraser Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was great - hot and cold selections on offer.
reviews.title: Great stay

likes.liked: — Value for money, clean modern rooms, service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location is very close to the subway station but of course as a tourist if you could stay next to circular quay I would recommend it to avoid the multiple trips to this central departure point to most tourist spots. The immediate area is also a little run down & not the best for shopping unless you are looking for a few bars & adult magazine stores.The staff were all very friendly & helpful from the front desk to the cleaners, the pool is a good size although they ran out of towels on multiple accassions. We stayed in a 2 bedroom, were they connect a studio to a one bedroom. Both rooms were clean but I would say the studio was no larger than an average hotel room & the only difference from a 3/4 star hotel room was that they included a microwave & some cutlery, the one bedroom was also of an average size with only a sliding door separating the bedroom from the lounge/kitchen not providing much separation of noise etc. We were on the 38/f so had good views but overall giving up the extra services of a hotel I would expect more square feet & more in room facilities.
reviews.title: no complaints but not fantastic either

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I loved this apartment hotel. I stayed in a one bedroom apartment for 7 days and found it had everything I needed. The apartment was very spacious and I felt relaxed and comfortable as soon as I walked into my room - a good feeling to have knowing youre away from home for more than a week. The staff were lovely on check-in and every other time I came across a staff member they were friendly. There was a very good feel about the hotel and I think its that the staff are happy and it makes it nicer for people like me to stay there. I would definitely stay again, even for one night. I did check out the smaller Studio suites because I had read other reviews about this hotel however I found them the same size as any other hotel room around the world - much bigger than rooms in Europe!! And if you want space, buy a bigger room and get the one bedroom apartment. The indoor pool was excellent and I recommend utilising the Personal Trainer in the hotel gym - he was helpful as well as knowing his stuff. Overall I would rate this as the best apartment/hotel I have stayed in in Sydney over the past 5-6 years.
reviews.title: Loved it! The one bedroom apartment was roomy and great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have stayed at Fraser Suites about five times over the past year, in between trying other hotels in Sydney, and now realise I am not willing to give them another chance. For some reason, I have been forgiving of this place in the past, probably because it was new and I was willing to left stuff go. But this time, the service, the cost of breakfast, and the tiredness of the rooms became the straws that broke the camel's back.
reviews.title: Stayed before, won't give them another chance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simply put, it's time to try other hotels, because this one doesn't offer much more than many others. It is certainly not five-star... definitely not my interpretation of five-star, which would include staff who are willing to go out of their way to help guests who are staying in the most expensive apartments.
reviews.title: Very overpriced and very small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in a Premier Apartment, which I was told was the best quality apartment, but was very dissapointed. Looking out on to air conditioning units is not a five-star experience. Air-conditioners that switch on, and then rattle the building, are not five-star experiences. Waiting for two hours to get toilet paper is not a five-star experience.
reviews.title: Great hotel - great location

description: Fraser Suites Sydney ~ deluxe 5 star rated and multi-award winning serviced apartments located in Sydney's central business district and next to Darling Harbour. Accommodation ranges from studios, one bedroom suites, two bedroom suites or stunning duplex penthouses, embodied in a striking glass tower. Designed by Foster + Partner's architects the building is complimented by modern design elements, with decor and furnishings that evoke a sense of Manhattan style. Guests enjoy complimentary access to an inspiring leisure centre featuring a fully equipped gymnasium, spa, sauna and heated pool. Breakfast is served daily on the Mezzanine level and room service is available in the evening. Guests may stay overnight, a week or even longer, as many of our suites offer a full galley kitchen (incl stove top, oven, microwave, dishwasher, cutlery and crockery), washing machine, dryer, dining table and lounge area.Guests can immerse themselves in a kaleidoscope of shopping, cinemas, entertainment, restaurants, bars, banks, corporate headquarters, supermarkets, picturesque walks, theatres and children's activities all within walking distance from the front door.
